job title: Principal Data Mining Specialist - Big Data
company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Louisiana
job description:
We take great strides to ensure our employees have the resources to live well, be healthy, continue learning, develop skills, grow professionally and serve our local communities. We invite you to apply for a career with Blue Cross.

You should know that:

+ Jobs are updated and posted daily.

+ You must submit your resume online.

+ Apply for each position for which you are qualified and interested in.

+ You will only be considered for positions for which you apply.

+ Resumes are only accepted for posted positions.

+ Positions are full-time unless otherwise stated.

+ Due to the high volume of applicants, only those most qualified will be contacted.

+ We are unable to accept phone calls.
  • *POSITION PURPOSE** **:**
The Principal Data Mining Specialist - Big Data will be responsible for developing patterns & practices and support for analytical consumption of the Data Lake by data analysts and data scientists in a reliable, repeatable and scalable manner to deliver fast time-to-value. Additionally, the Specialist will be responsible ensuring data quality and searchability of data sets in the Data Lake for the enterprise. This position plays an integral role in supporting the company?s strategic direction to be a data and analytics driven.

Accountable for complying with all laws and regulations associated with duties and responsibilities.

  • *Necessary Contacts** :
To do this job effectively the incumbent has to be in contact with data scientists, team members, departmental management, vendors, and consultants.

  • *QUALIFICATIONS** :
Bachelor?s Degree in Business, Finance, and Computer Science, Mathematics or related field is required. Four years of related experience can be used in lieu of a degree.

At least 7 years of professional information technology experience to include a minimum of two years of experience in SQL and programming languages such as Python, Java, Perl.

Strong statistical understanding with experience in R and/or SAS languages is preferred.

Understanding of data cleansing and munging techniques as well as staying current with emerging tools and techniques in machine learning, statistical modeling and analytics.

Employing best practices to analyze large amounts of data while maintaining intense attention to detail.

Ability to creatively think and question established business practices and brainstorming new approaches to data analysis.

Strong verbal and written communication skills, time management and organizational skills. Able to multitask and adapt quickly to change and coordinate activities with others.

  • *ACCOUNTABILITIES & ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS** :
Demonstrate the ability to adapt and work with team members of various experience level.

Provide support and best practices to assist in the wrangling, discovery, and exploratory analysis by Data Analysts and Data Scientist using statistical, analytic, and visualization tools on the Big Data platform as well as machine learning, natural language process, and artificial intelligence services.

Perform strategic data analysis, data cleansing and data validation from raw data zone.

Collaborate with Data Governance and Data Stewards to catalog and tag dataset to support the ongoing process of ensuring data quality and searchability

Facilitate and operationalize the storage and compute management as well as scripting needs such as R, Python, and SQL by Data Scientist to run analytical models.

Understands Departmental Goals and Objectives and deliver work products to contribute to those goals as well as advancing Analytics and EIM division.

Job duties are performed in a normal and clean office environment with normal noise levels.

Work is predominately done while sitting or standing.

The ability to comprehend, document, calculate, visualize, and analyze are required.

Physical effort is required to lift, hold, and carry objects up to 15 pounds, occasionally.

_The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees so classified._
